content.text:
[@xj9.2](@xuq5ATR6hDNt6/0q1RB+L1f0dyeVk1kG1JAXu4jo/GU=.ed25519) Thanks! I didn't know you needed an IPv6 address to resolve AAAA records, is that a thing? I only have IPv4 at home and it looks like this for me:

```console
$ dig +short AAAA libra.fraction.io
fc7d:ebb9:ee1b:912b:467:9b3a:2162:b951
```

And because I'm running #cjdns on both devices:

```console
$ ping libra.fraction.io
PING libra.fraction.io(fc7d:ebb9:ee1b:912b:467:9b3a:2162:b951 (fc7d:ebb9:ee1b:912b:467:9b3a:2162:b951)) 56 data bytes
64 bytes from fc7d:ebb9:ee1b:912b:467:9b3a:2162:b951 (fc7d:ebb9:ee1b:912b:467:9b3a:2162:b951): icmp_seq=1 ttl=42 time=224 ms
64 bytes from fc7d:ebb9:ee1b:912b:467:9b3a:2162:b951 (fc7d:ebb9:ee1b:912b:467:9b3a:2162:b951): icmp_seq=2 ttl=42 time=248 ms
64 bytes from fc7d:ebb9:ee1b:912b:467:9b3a:2162:b951 (fc7d:ebb9:ee1b:912b:467:9b3a:2162:b951): icmp_seq=3 ttl=42 time=149 ms
^C
--- libra.fraction.io ping statistics ---
3 packets transmitted, 3 received, 0% packet loss, time 5ms
rtt min/avg/max/mdev = 149.420/207.087/247.704/41.896 ms
```
